newsitem.title: USA: Amquest ponders buyback, management shift.
newsitem.headline: Amquest ponders buyback, management shift.

text.p: Amquest International Inc on Tuesday said it plans significant changes in management and is considering a share buyback in response to the drop in its stock price.
The company's stock has fallen from a high of 7-7/8 earlier this year to a close Monday of 0.28. The company said its stock has suffered from a series of management and business setbacks.

First, a planned acquisition failed to close last month, it said. Then last week the board chairman, two outside directors and the corporate secretary resigned, expressing a lack of confidence in whether the company can bring its HomeVest Mortgage to market without completing an acquisition within the home sales or mortgage industries, it said.

Amquest said the HomeVest Mortgage is a "total package mortgage," in which a number of the services associated with the sale of a home are bundled into one transaction and may include rebates and discounts.

The company said it is considering a share buyback along with other significant capital changes. It also plans to seek new board members and senior staff who have a broader-based business discipline, it said.
